WRITING.TEXT: Yes! A lot of the time it's when we turn around too - and if she's with my husband and I she'll walk the whole time... or hiking... if she's with one of us she puts the brakes on. Glad it's not just us

Yeah maybe we made a mistake by giving her a treat when she jumps up onto the bench -
The walk thing is weird - she has a harness... I can tug on her, try to get her moving - but she just puts major breaks on. Ends with me carrying her. I know she has me wrapped around her little paw and she's picked up a few bad habits! Need to get some training going
Yeah! I love the other photos that are posted in the story too - such a positive message
Good point - she's a blogger so probably staged for a pretty shot, but still, awesome message to get out there!

WRITING.TITLE: Stubborn Westie
WRITING.TEXT:
I obviously love my Westie more than anything - but wondering if anyone else has these issues and solutions -
Abbey just turned 4 and every night she jumps off of our bed - then whines to get back up in the middle of the night. This happens about three times a night (when she used to sleep through the night). We put a bench at the end of the bed and are trying to bribe her with treats - she does it just fine on her own when we're not there but not in the middle of the night.
Also on walks - she'll beg to go - but puts the "brakes" on multiple times if we're walking through the neighborhood - but can hike just fine for 3 plus miles.
Anyone else deal with this? Westie tips appreciated!
Oh no! I was brainwashed! Wonder what other things I picked up from all that binge watching back in the day

Well... I did watch a lot of Nickelodeon and I remember that commercial - who says TV doesn't influence kids ; ) think I heard about "rabbit, rabbit" from my British friend first - maybe it's a European thing!
Valid point! Sick of throwing away rent $$$

Thoughts on Lafayette - many people are priced out of Moraga and Orinda, cute downtown with newer restaurants, shops - still close to shopping in Walnut Creek and a bit closer to jobs in Oakland and the city... overpriced though
HAHA figured as much

WRITING.TITLE: Childhood habit
WRITING.TEXT: Anyone else say "rabbit, rabbit" on the first of the month for good luck? Was alerted by co-workers this is not normal... and I'm not superstitious! They had never even heard of it.
Perhaps it's becoming glamorized by being featured in shows including 'The People vs. O.J. Simpson,' 'Narcos' and 'Cartel Land.' ;)
Looking at Alameda, Walnut Creek, maybe Berkeley or Lafayette

Thanks for the insights! So many mixed reviews... I guess the bottom line is no one knows for sure (obviously). It's just scary to potentially get in at the top, and crazy how much prices have increased over the past few years. Seems over-inflated. Although they could just keep going up. It is the best place in the world to live - just have to keep reminding myself that!
Strange! Haven't experienced that... although I've heard it's popular among personal trainers in the city for whatever reason. What neighborhoods were you in?
Things will always get better - please hang in there, and reach out for help!
